MS MCQs

    Discover Microsoft safety guidelines for responsible conversational AI development

    »

    1. What is the best way to identify the biases a bot may have before deployment?

      A review of the literature around your bots use case.

      Thorough testing of the bots responses in a test environment.

      Include fairness and diversity at every level of the ideation and creation process.

      A systematic review of all datasets being used.


    2. What information should your bot collect?

      All information possible.

      Only information from users that it needs to perform its job.

      Age and gender information.

      As much information as possible while hiding the fact your bot is collecting information.


    3. How should you plan to tackle abnormal behavior and misuse of your bot?

      Have systems to detect abnormal behaviors and prevent manipulation.

      Design your bot so abnormal behaviors and manipulation are impossible.

      You should not worry about abnormal behavior and misuse - it is expected of chatbots.

      Use trusted libraries and frameworks during code development.


    4. Who is responsible for your bot?

      The end user.

      Company leadership.

      There’s no responsibility - people don’t have to user your bot if they don’t want to.

      The developers of bots have responsibility and are accountable for their bots.
